method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the values of all clients

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The success response is returned in the requested format. Errors are always returned in JSON.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
'index' is a temporary list number. No value is tied to the index value. It is valid for this response only.
A JSON response that includes the key 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET

doc.title: Client values by client name and org

method.doc: Get the values of a client by the name and optionally the organization

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: name
param.doc: the client name

param.name: org
param.doc: the org(anization)

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
'index' is a temporary list number. No value is tied to the index value. It is valid for this response only.
A JSON response that includes the key 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: The client_id of the client is returned. In the context of OAuth 1.0 it is the oauth_consumer_key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' will appear once or not at all.
'index' is a temporary list number. No value is tied to the index value. It is valid for this response only.
A JSON response that includes the key 'values'. 'value' will appear once or not at all.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' will appear once or not at all.

The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the values of a client_id by client_ident

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: the client_ident which may result in many associated client_ids

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
'index' is a temporary list number. No value is tied to the index value. It is valid for this response only.
A JSON response that includes the key 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the values of a client_id by using additional filter

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
In combination with 'client_ident' and 'filterStatus' optionally add one of these combinations:
(register_by|environment) OR (registered_by) OR (environment) OR (client_key)

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: the client_ident

param.name: filterStatus
param.doc: the status

param.name: registered_by
param.doc: whoever has registered the client

param.name: environment
param.doc: the environment

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_key. In the context of OAuth 1.0 it is the oauth_consumer_key, in OAuth 2.0 the client_id

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
'index' is a temporary list number. No value is tied to the index value. It is valid for this response only.
A JSON response that includes the key 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET

doc.title: Get client and client_id values in one request

method.doc: Get the values of a clients and client_ids in one request. By default this method is used when processing oauth token requests.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
The response will have two more child elements which are surrounding the result of 'get' and 'getKey' operations.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: The OAuth 2.0 client_id. In the context of OAuth 1.0, this is the oauth_consumer_key.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

representation.doc: <values xmlns="http://ns.l7tech.com/2012/11/otk-clientstore"> <clients><values> ... see result from 'get' ... </values></clients> <keys><values> ... see result from 'getKey' ... </values></keys> </values>

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is not valid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Registers a new client on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: The unique identifier of this client within the oauth client storage.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name given for this client.

param.name: org
param.doc: The organization that is registering this client.

param.name: registered_by
param.doc: The user who registers.

param.name: type
param.doc: For OAuth 2.0 clients, either 'confidential' or 'public'.

param.name: description
param.doc: An optional description.

param.name: client_custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values.

param.name: persist_type
param.doc: MUST be 'client'.

response.doc: Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The client could not be persisted due to duplicate values.
The used 'persist_type' is invalid.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
If the given custom field is not a valid JSON object.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Registers a new client_id for a known client on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: It has to match an existing 'client_ident' on the OAuth server. This client_id will be added as an addition for the referenced client.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: The client_id to be registered. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key'.

param.name: registered_by
param.doc: The user who registers.

param.name: status
param.doc: Either 'ENABLED' or 'DISABLED'.

param.name: expiration
param.doc: This is the expiration date in seconds (unix timestamp). The value '0' indicates no expiration.

param.name: secret
param.doc: The client_secret to be registered. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key_secret'.
For OAuth 2.0 clients of 'type=public' this value is optional when requesting an access_token

param.name: scope
param.doc: The SCOPE to be available for this client_id. Used with OAuth 2.0 only.

param.name: callback
param.doc: In OAuth 2.0 this is the 'redirect_uri'. Although it is optional it should contain a value.

param.name: environment
param.doc: This can be used to categorize the client_id, e.g.: 'environment=iOS' if this client_id will be used for iOS clients.

param.name: client_key_custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values.

param.name: service_ids
param.doc: A comma separated list of serviceIds for which this client_id is valid. It is used in the context of CA API Portal.

param.name: account_plan_mapping_ids
param.doc: A comma separated list of account plan mapping ID's. It is used in the context of CA API Portal.

param.name: persist_type
param.doc: MUST be 'client_key'.

response.doc: The client_id could not be persisted due to duplicate values.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The used 'persist_type' is invalid.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
If the given custom field is not a valid JSON object.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Registers a new client including a new client_id on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: The unique identifier of this client within the oauth client storage.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: The client_id to be registered. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key'.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name given for this client.

param.name: org
param.doc: The organization that is registering this client.

param.name: registered_by
param.doc: The user who registers.

param.name: type
param.doc: For OAuth 2.0 clients, either 'confidential' or 'public'.

param.name: description
param.doc: An optional description.

param.name: status
param.doc: Either 'ENABLED' or 'DISABLED'.

param.name: expiration
param.doc: This is the expiration date in seconds (unix timestamp). The value '0' indicates no expiration.

param.name: secret
param.doc: The client_secret to be registered. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key_secret'.

param.name: scope
param.doc: The SCOPE to be available for this client_id. Used with OAuth 2.0 only.

param.name: callback
param.doc: In OAuth 2.0 this is the 'redirect_uri'. Although it is optional it should contain a value.

param.name: environment
param.doc: This can be used to categorize the client_id, e.g.: 'environment=iOS' if this client_id will be used for iOS clients.

param.name: client_custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values for a client.

param.name: client_key_custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values for a client_key (client_id, oauth_consumer_key, apiKey).

param.name: service_ids
param.doc: A comma separated list of serviceIds for which this client_id is valid. It is used in the context of CA API Portal.

param.name: account_plan_mapping_ids
param.doc: A comma separated list of account plan mapping ID's. It is used in the context of CA API Portal.

param.name: persist_type
param.doc: MUST be 'client_and_key'.

response.doc: The client_id could not be persisted due to duplicate values.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The used 'persist_type' is invalid.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
If the given custom field is not a valid JSON object.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Deletes a client and all its client_id's of the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: The unique identifier of this client that should be deleted. All client_id's will also be removed.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Revokes one or many client_id(s).

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
In comparison to '/delete' this API only deletes client_ids, not the client itself.
Only one of the parameters can be and has to be used.

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: The unique identifier of this client of which the client_ids should be revoked. Use this instead of 'client_key'.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: The client_id to be revoked. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key'. Use this instead of 'client_ident'.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Updates the values of the client of the given client_ident

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
Empty values or missing parameters will overwrite existing values!

param.name: client_ident
param.doc: the client identified by the client_ident will be updated

param.name: name
param.doc: the new name.

param.name: type
param.doc: Used and required for OAuth 2.0. The new type, either 'confidential' or 'public'.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description.

param.name: org
param.doc: the new organization

param.name: client_custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values for a client.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Updates values for the given client_id.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
Empty values will overwrite existing values!

param.name: client_key
param.doc: update the values of the given client_key. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key'.

param.name: secret
param.doc: The client_secret to be updated. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key_secret'.

param.name: status
param.doc: Either 'ENABLED' or 'DISABLED'.

param.name: scope
param.doc: the new scope. The SCOPE to be updated for this client_id. Used with OAuth 2.0 only.

param.name: callback
param.doc: new callback (redirect_uri). In OAuth 2.0 this is the 'redirect_uri'. This value is only verified in OAuth 2.0.

param.name: environment
param.doc: set the new environment. This can be used to categorize the client_id, e.g.: 'environment=iOS' if this client_id will be used for iOS clients.

param.name: client_key_custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values for a client_key (client_id, oauth_consumer_key, apiKey).

param.name: service_ids
param.doc: A comma separated list of serviceIds for which this client_id is valid. It is used in the context of CA API Portal.

param.name: account_plan_mapping_ids
param.doc: A comma separated list of account plan mapping ID's. It is used in the context of CA API Portal.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST

doc.title: Updates a username of whom registered the client_id

method.doc: Updates a 'created_by' value client_id.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: The client_id to be updated. In the context of OAuth 1.0 this is the 'oauth_consumer_key'.

param.name: created_by
param.doc: Update the value of whoever registered the client_id.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The path component is invalid.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.
